name: Auth0

aliases.name: Endpoint
aliases.comment:
Auth0 Endpoint of Authentication API and Management API

e.g. <https://your-auth0-app.auth0.com>

aliases.name: IdToken
aliases.comment:
The idToken returns from Auth0 authenticated result, it is usually in JSON
Web Token ([JWT](https://jwt.io)) format.

aliases.name: OAuth2Identity
aliases.comment:
The OAuth2 identity of the unified user profile. This usually tell the
social account or database account linked with the unified user profile.
aliases.type: { connection : String , isSocial : Bool , provider : String , user_id : String }

aliases.name: Profile
aliases.comment:
Auth0 unified user profile

The `user_metatdata` and `app_metadata` varies in different application.
You should define your own `user_metadata` and `app_metadata` records.
aliases.type: { email : String , email_verified : Bool , created_at : Date.Date , family_name : Maybe.Maybe String , given_name : Maybe.Maybe String , global_client_id : Maybe.Maybe String , identities : List Auth0.OAuth2Identity , locale : Maybe.Maybe String , name : String , nickname : String , picture : String , user_id : Auth0.UserID , user_metadata : Maybe.Maybe userMetaData , app_metadata : Maybe.Maybe appMetaData }

aliases.name: UserID
aliases.comment: Represent the Auth0 unified user ID

values.name: auth0AuthorizeURL
values.comment:
Create the URL to the login page

    auth0AuthorizeURL :
        Auth0Config
        -> String -- responseType
        -> String -- redirectURL
        -> List String -- scopes
        -> Maybe String -- connection
        -> String

e.g.

    auth0AuthorizeURL
        (Auth0Config "https://my-app.auth0.com" "aBcD1234")
        "token"
        "https://my-app/"
        [ "openid", "name", "email" ]
        (Just "google-oauth2")
values.type: Auth0.Auth0Config -> String -> String -> List String -> Maybe.Maybe String -> String

values.name: getAuthedUserProfile
values.comment: Get the Auth0 unified user profile which is represented by the `IdToken`
values.type: Auth0.Endpoint -> Auth0.IdToken -> Json.Decode.Decoder profile -> Http.Request profile

values.name: profileDecoder
values.comment:
Auth0 unified user profile decoder

The `user_metatdata` and `app_metadata` varies in different application.
You should define your own `user_metadata` and `app_metadata` decoders.
values.type: Json.Decode.Decoder a -> Json.Decode.Decoder b -> Json.Decode.Decoder (Auth0.Profile a b)

values.name: updateUserMetaData
values.comment: Update the `user_metadata` in the Auth0 unified user profile
values.type: Auth0.Endpoint -> Auth0.IdToken -> Auth0.UserID -> Json.Encode.Value -> Json.Decode.Decoder profile -> Http.Request profile
